sen.j: 撰国史所（せんこくししょ）は、律令制下の日本で正史である六国史及び『新国史』を編纂するために設置された機関。
sen.e: Senkokushisho was the organization which was established in the era when Japan was under the Ritsuryo system for the purpose of compiling official history book Rikkokushi (the Six National histories) and " Shin-kokushi" (the New National History).

Senkokushisho was the organization which was established while Japan was under the Ritsuryo system, for the purpose of compiling official history book Rikkokushi (the Six National histories) and " Shin-kokushi" (the New National History).

Senkokushisho was the organization which was established while Japan was under the Ritsuryo system, for the purpose of compiling official history book Rikkokushi (the Six National histories) and "Shin-kokushi" (the New National History).
sen.cmt: スペースをのぞきました。

sen.j: 日本の律令法によれば、図書寮が国史編纂の任に当たる事になっていたが、実際の図書寮にはそれを行うだけの史料の集積も人材もなかったと考えられている（律令制実務における記録や行政文書の集積は、後日に先例として参考にするために内記や外記などで行われたと見られている）。
sen.e: According to the Japanese Ritsuryo code, compilation of official history book was the job of Zushoryo (the Bureau of Drawings and Books), but it is considered that Zushoryo actually lacked historical materials and human resources necessary for doing such job (it is considered that the records and precedents concerning the jobs under the Ritsuryo system were accumulated by Naiki (Secretary of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Geki (Secretary of the Grand Council of State) for the purpose of future reference).

sen.cmt: スペースを補足しました。

sen.j: このため、実際には国史編纂にあたって天皇から任命された貴族・官人がこれにあたった。
sen.e: Therefore, court nobles and government officials who were nominated by the emperor were actually engaged in this job.

sen.j: 「撰国史所」は長期間にわたって事業が継続された新国史（未完）編纂時の機関の呼称であり、名称については『続日本紀』の編纂機関が「撰続日本紀所」であったことが判明している（『日本後紀』延暦16年2月13日条）。
sen.e: "Senkokushisho" was the name of organization that engaged in the lengthy compilation work of Shin-kokushi (unfinished) and the name of organization that compiled "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued) was "Senshokunihongisho" ("Nihon Koki" (Later Chronicle of Japan) dated March 19, 797).

sen.e: However, there are many instances where the name of organization was unclear and therefore, "Senkokushisho" is used as the term that mean history compilation bureau in broad sense.

sen.e: According to the Imperial decree relating to Senkokushisho issued for the purpose of compiling Shin-kokushi as well as "Seikyuki" and "Shingishiki", compilation of official history was conducted once for several emperors era.

sen.j: 別当などと呼ばれる総裁役には大臣・大納言の一上級の貴族が就任し、参議級が執行役となる。
sen.e: High-ranking court nobles like Otodo (minister) or Dainagon (chief councilor of state) were appointed to its head called betto etc. and Sangi (councilor) class persons were appointed to executive officer.

sen.j: 『続日本後紀』や『日本文徳天皇実録』のように1代の天皇のみを扱った国史が編纂されたり、『新国史』のように長期化して最終的に完成しなかった例もあり、9世紀後半から10世紀前半には事務機関が断続的に設置されていた時期があったとする説もある。
sen.e: In view of the existence of the official history book which described only one emperor, such as "Shoku Nihonkoki" and "Nihon Montoku-tenno Jitsroku", or the one whose compilation work lasted long and eventually stopped without being completed, such as "Shin-kokushi", some people assert that such organization was established intermittently during the period from the late 9th century to the early 10th century.
